intro: Dorstenia unyikae, commonly known as the Ugali plant, is a unique member of the Moraceae family, native to the tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiral-shaped leaves that are often used in traditional medicine and as a food source. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that develop into edible, fig-like fruits. Dorstenia unyikae thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and cultural studies in its native habitat.
